workflow.name: Verify property ownership with blockchain, GPT-4 fraud detection, and compliance tracking
workflow.description:
## How It Works
This workflow automates property registration verification, fraud detection, and blockchain-based compliance tracking by systematically assessing fraud risk, validating transactions, ensuring data immutability through cryptographic hashing, and recording property records on the blockchain. It ingests property registration data, applies GPT-4‚Äìdriven fraud analysis with risk scoring, and verifies transaction legitimacy against regulatory and contractual criteria. The system generates cryptographic hashes for property and lease records, validates compliance requirements using AI-based analysis, queries the blockchain for verification, logs transactions on-chain, stores audit records in structured sheets, and securely archives all supporting documentation. Designed for real estate firms, legal practices, and property management companies, it enables transparent verification, fraud mitigation, and tamper-resistant compliance tracking across the property lifecycle.

## Setup Steps
1. Configure property data source and set up OpenAI GPT-4 for fraud detection and compliance.
2. Connect blockchain network credentials and configure hash generation parameters.
3. Set up Google Sheets for audit logging and configure blockchain verification queries.
4. Define fraud risk thresholds, compliance criteria, and transaction validation rules.

## Prerequisites
Property registration data source; OpenAI API key; blockchain network access 
## Use Cases
Real estate firms automating fraud checks on property transactions; 
## Customization
Adjust fraud detection criteria and risk thresholds, modify blockchain network selection.
## Benefits
Eliminates manual fraud detection, prevents title fraud and forgery

workflow.name: Smart Blockchain Property Ledger and Proof-of-Ownership Verification

values.formSubmittedText: Your property has been successfully registered on the blockchain. You will receive a confirmation with the transaction hash.

parameters.formDescription: Register properties, leases, and transactions on the blockchain for immutable proof-of-ownership

options.systemMessage:
You are a fraud detection AI specialized in real estate transactions.

Your task is to analyze property transactions and assess fraud risk based on:
1. Property value anomalies (unusually high or low values for the location)
2. Owner information completeness and consistency
3. Transaction type patterns (frequent transfers may indicate flipping schemes)
4. Legal description clarity and completeness
5. Red flags in additional details

Provide a structured risk assessment with:
- riskLevel: "low", "medium", or "high"
- riskScore: 0-100 (0 = no risk, 100 = maximum risk)
- riskFactors: array of identified risk factors
- recommendation: action recommendation
- reasoning: brief explanation of the assessment

You are a regulatory compliance AI specialized in real estate law and property transactions.

Your task is to validate property transactions against regulatory requirements:
1. Verify all required fields are present and properly formatted
2. Check property value reporting thresholds
3. Validate legal description completeness
4. Identify missing documentation or information
5. Flag potential regulatory violations

Provide a structured compliance assessment with:
- compliant: true or false
- complianceScore: 0-100 (0 = non-compliant, 100 = fully compliant)
- violations: array of identified compliance issues
- missingFields: array of required fields that are missing or incomplete
- recommendation: compliance action recommendation

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
	"compliant": true,
	"complianceScore": 95,
	"violations": ["Missing property appraisal", "Incomplete owner verification"],
	"missingFields": ["taxId", "propertyAppraisal"],
	"recommendation": "Complete all required documentation before proceeding with registration"
}

parameters.content:
## Prerequisites
Property registration data source; OpenAI API key; blockchain network access 
## Use Cases
Real estate firms automating fraud checks on property transactions; 
## Customization
Adjust fraud detection criteria and risk thresholds, modify blockchain network selection.
## Benefits
Eliminates manual fraud detection, prevents title fraud and forgery

## Setup Steps
1. Configure property data source and set up OpenAI GPT-4 for fraud detection and compliance.
2. Connect blockchain network credentials and configure hash generation parameters.
3. Set up Google Sheets for audit logging and configure blockchain verification queries.
4. Define fraud risk thresholds, compliance criteria, and transaction

## How It Works
This workflow automates property registration verification, fraud detection, and blockchain-based compliance tracking by systematically assessing fraud risk, validating transactions, ensuring data immutability through cryptographic hashing, and recording property records on the blockchain. It ingests property registration data, applies GPT-4‚Äìdriven fraud analysis with risk scoring, and verifies transaction legitimacy against regulatory and contractual criteria. The system generates cryptographic hashes for property and lease records, validates compliance requirements using AI-based analysis, queries the blockchain for verification, logs transactions on-chain, stores audit records in structured sheets, and securely archives all supporting documentation. Designed for real estate firms, legal practices, and property management companies, it enables transparent verification, fraud mitigation, and tamper-resistant compliance tracking across the property lifecycle.

## Generate Cryptographic Hashes & Log Compliance Results
What: Creates property and lease hashes for blockchain registration and immutable records.
Why: Enables tamper-proof documentation and cryptographic verification of property details.

## Validate Transaction Type
What: Checks property transactions against compliance rules and legitimacy criteria.
Why: Ensures transactions conform to legal requirements

## Assess Fraud Risk
What: Uses GPT-4 to analyze property registration data and assign fraud risk scores.
Why: Identifies suspicious transactions and high-risk activities before processing.

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
